admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
Morocco's structural adjustment
            program aims to achieve a sustainable increase in the rate
            of economic growth in order to ensure employment
            opportunities and acceptable living standards for its
            growing population, while enhancing external
            creditworthiness. This First Structural Adjustment Loan will
            support the first phase of a program of action covering an
            increase in the levels of public revenues and savings to
            finance essential infrastructure and social investment,
            while reducing the need for public sector borrowing. Also
            financed will be the further rationalization of trade and
            industrial policies, and the elaboration of an external
            liability management plan. Specific policy measures, tax
            policy and administration, public investment budget, and
            export promotion, will help raise the overall efficiency of
            the economy in line with the program goals.
